answers.answer: That is so scary. I'm always worried about high blood sugar and seldom think of the lows. After this incident I'm sure your husband will be more observant.

:( im sorry this happened. How scary. My husband and I rarely wake up when the other comes and goes from the bathroom at night.Maybe come up with a safety plan now? (Ill throw out a few starter ideas)Wake him up (lightly) when you get up to go? Check levels in bed then wake him up if you get up?Call someone on the phone who is a few time zones ahead?Turn your bedside light on?Wear a diaper of sorts so you dont risk falling?Disclaimer: I know a few of these ideas are soooo not ideal but im thinking safety first for you... falling is super dangerous.

question: Well I ate the wrong thing and my blood sugars shot very high. I took my insulin, then the last thing I remember was going to the bathroom... don't know what time that was, but woke up sometime later in the bathroom floor. Now my blood sugars are lower, but I have ketones still. This is the scariest thing I've had happen this pregnancy... I just need to vent. I can't believe my husband didn't come check on me when I didn't come back to bed. I guess he was in too deep of a sleep...
title: Diabetes Issues
